comments.body:
Traps are deliberately omitted from the combat log to prevent abuse. If they did show up, traps would be pretty lame.


> Posted by CurseForge user Cybeloras

I think I may not have explained what I am looking for good enough. I thought I could use the Spell Create option of the Combat Event icon, but after your response, I think I am going about it the wrong way.

I am looking for a timer to show the remaining life of a casted trap. The timer would count down until the trap either expires or is triggered. I am able to do the first part with an Internal Cooldown icon, but the timer continues to count down if the trap is triggered.

Edited Nov 10, 2015

> Posted by CurseForge user cosmicflatulance

@Cybeloras: Go

I am looking for a timer to show the remaining life of a casted trap. The timer would count down until the trap either expires or is triggered. I am able to do the first part with an Internal Cooldown icon, but the timer continues to count down if the trap is triggered.


> Posted by CurseForge user cosmicflatulance

Add a Counter notification with the On Start trigger on the Internal Cooldown icon that you made that sets a counter to 1. Then, create a Combat Event icon with an Aura Applied event for your trap with the source filter set to "player", and add a Counter notification to that icon that will set the same counter that you used for the first icon to 0.

Finally, add a condition to the Internal Cooldown that checks that the counter that you made is equal to 1. You can set the Combat Event icon to always hide - it is just a helper to figure out when you have a trap out.

Edited Nov 11, 2015
